snippet: The Dalai Lama, Tibet’s exiled spiritual leader, told the BBC he would rather there be no Dalai Lama than that a “stupid” successor replace him.
abstract: Dalai Lama, Tibet's exiled spiritual leader, says in BBC interview that he would rather have no successor than be replaced by inadequate spiritual leader; China has said that Dalai Lama tradition must continue and that it must approve successor.
lead_paragraph: The Dalai Lama, Tibet’s exiled spiritual leader, told the BBC he would rather there be no Dalai Lama than that a “stupid” successor replace him.

headline.main: China: Dalai Lama Hints Spiritual Line Might Come to an End With Him
headline.print_headline: China: Dalai Lama Hints Spiritual Line Might Come to an End With Him
